title: (x) RB logo classic serif face - Lynton {Mike Y}
content:
Hi!

I wonder if someone could give me a clue as to what the font in the following picture might be? Okay, I suppose I’m making this difficult by only supplying two characters, but something near would be great.

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/head02_5303.gif)

 [‹ (x) "John Harrigan" modulated sans - Optima {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31019 "Go to previous forum topic") ["On Her Majesty's Secret Service" elongated serif font (1970s) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30995 "Go to next forum topic")
author: maffp

comments.content:
I think this may be Colin Brignall’s [’Edwardian Light’](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.100642.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=RB&sampleSize=48)

- Mike Yanega

Upon further review I think I will change my guess to Lynton by Les Usherwood. The letters seem closer, and the R tail would be more easily elongated to match.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/lynton_full_6516.gif)

Here’s a link to [Lynton](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007182842/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/lynton-bq/).

- Mike Yanega
